text:
Goa Chief Minister Laxmikant Parsekar on Friday said he was waiting for prison officials’ report on assault on a tribal activist in judicial custody.

Ravindra Velip has alleged that a BJP legislator and a mining firm owner were behind the attack.

“I am waiting for the report from prison authorities. Once I get the report I can decide the course of action,” Mr. Parsekar told reporters.

Velip was assaulted inside Sada sub-jail on Wednesday before he was released on bail. He was among several persons from the tribal community of Cauvrem arrested for opposing transportation of iron ore by a mining firm.

“When I was going to toilet...was suddenly attacked from behind by four persons, who blindfolded and gagged me with a cloth and then went on to beat me,” the complaint says. — PTI
title: Assault on tribal activist in jail: Goa CM seeks report
